messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] reluctant ex
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 2/17/03 3:05:01 PM, kellitraas@yahoo.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 2/17/03 3:05:01 PM, kellitraas@... writes:

<< Lee,
I also would second David Gutterson's book, it was the first homeschooling
book I read and my husband seemed to really relate to it. Its not
entirely unschooling but it has lots of great points.

Kelli >>

Right.
Guys like it.<g>

The Homeschooling Book of Answers is better for women, in my opinion.
Men don't seem to like lots of answers by moms. They want answers by men.

Sandra

messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] reluctant ex
messages.msgSnippet: Lee, I also would second David Gutterson s book,   it was the first homeschooling book I read and my husband seemed to really relate to it.         Its not
messages.messageBody:
Lee,
I also would second David Gutterson's book, it was the first homeschooling book I read and my husband seemed to really relate to it. Its not entirely unschooling but it has lots of great points.

Kelli


coyote's corner <jana@...> wrote:Lee,
I'm new to this, so I have no suggestions. I'll just say that I'll wish &
hope that he steps up to where you are.
Janis

-----Original Message-----
From: Lee Roversi [mailto:ncfarms@...]
Sent: Sunday, February 16, 2003 5:34 PM
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] reluctant ex

Dear listmates-
If you had to recommend to a very reluctant ex-spouse one book, one
article, one magazine or one website in order to help him see the worth of
unschooling . . . which one would it be? My ex-husband is really working my
children and me on their education (or lack of it, as he sees it). The ex
isn't not much of a reader, so I'm looking for the quintessential book to
suggest to him. I have never been happier with my children and their paths,
so this comes at a horrible time for me. . . just when I am finally
relaxing into this and truly seeing the worth. Thanks for your help.
In aloha, Lee

ncfarms@... writes:


> If you had to recommend to a very reluctant ex-spouse one book, one
> article, one magazine or one website in order to help him see the worth of

One book---Mary Griffith's Unschooling Handbook

One website----unschooling.com

One e-list----this crazy one, on a good day! <G>

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] reluctant ex
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 2/16/03 3:36:02 PM, ncfarms@aloha.net writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 2/16/03 3:36:02 PM, ncfarms@... writes:

<< If you had to recommend to a very reluctant ex-spouse one book, one
article, one magazine or one website in order to help him see the worth of
unschooling . . . which one would it be? >>

For a male-person, "Family Matters" by David Gutersson.

<A
HREF="http://www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/tg/detail/-/0156300001/002-4177569-445

0413?vi=glance">Amazon.com: Books: Family Matters : Why Homeschâ€¦</A>


You can order a used one from Amazon.


Sandra
